result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Alex Reich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 02/26/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-24

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: DNA sample; pay the surcharge. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending a review on 02-26-16
*8/26/2016  Order for Commitment signed/filed.  To serve 30 days. Straight time. No good time credit.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Robert Alex Reich
Current: 9060 W. Oklahoma Ave. Apt 201, Milwaukee, WI 53227 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2016)
Prior: 3059 South 94th Street, West Allis, WI 53227

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court PRO SE.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Further review not needed.
Per agent request, case adjourned for Probation Review Hearing due to defendant being sentenced on other case. Case adjourned to 8/26/2016 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation. Court STAYED 3 days condition time.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $228.00 entered as ordered by the court on 11/20/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 02/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed on 11/20/15.  Copy sent to defendant.  rmm

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court with attorney Matt Last.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent with Count 1 in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 24.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court with attorney Matt Last.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Counsel was held up in another court and matter could not be heard.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court with attorney Matt Last.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-30-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-14-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense.  Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Matt Last to represent defendant at the rate of $60 per hour;  Attorney Last present in court and accepted the appointment. 

Court ordered Defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $50 per month, beginning October 1, 2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Order Appointing Counsel signed by the Court and filed.  Copies to be mailed to the parties.

Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.  Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant informed the Court he is hiring counsel.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Evelyn Z. and L.J.R. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Robert Alex Reich in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/1/15 @ 1:30pm
